properties.TITLE: Battle of the Trebia River
properties.Description: Hannibal's forces defeated a larger Roman army led by Sempronius, showcasing his strategic brilliance and setting the stage for his invasion of Italy.

properties.TITLE: Battle of Lake Trasimene
properties.Description: Hannibal again outmaneuvered a Roman army, led by Gaius Flaminius, in a deadly ambush, resulting in a devastating victory for the Carthaginians.

properties.TITLE: Battle of Cannae
properties.Description: This is arguably one of the most famous battles of the Second Punic War, where Hannibal's smaller force encircled and decimated a much larger Roman army, showcasing his tactical genius.

properties.TITLE: Battle of Zama
properties.Description: This battle in North Africa saw Scipio Africanus decisively defeat Hannibal, effectively ending the Second Punic War and establishing Roman dominance in the region.

properties.TITLE: Battle of Geronium
properties.Description: This battle resulted in a tactical victory for the Carthaginian general Hannibal Barca, consolidating his position in southern Italy and further undermining Roman morale.

properties.TITLE: Battle of the Metaurus
properties.Description: This battle in Italy marked a turning point, as the Roman army defeated Hasdrubal, Hannibal's brother, who was attempting to join him with reinforcements.

properties.TITLE: Battle of Baecula
properties.Description: This was as a major field battle in Iberia during the Second Punic War. Roman Republican and Iberian auxiliary forces under the command of Scipio Africanus routed the Carthaginian army of Hasdrubal Barca.

properties.TITLE: Siege of Syracuse
properties.Description: While not a traditional battle, the siege of Syracuse, a major ally of Rome, was a significant strategic event, ultimately leading to the city's capture by the Romans.
